title: im glad that if i see a teemo adc+jax support
body: and they feed 26 of our team's 40 deaths, i just have to sit there and take it. can't call them out for trolling, can't request for enemy team to report them, can't do anything but be silent or risk getting reported for unsportsmanlike conduct and get chat banned by the automated system. great job riot, great system you've got here. i mean, all they have to do is cry waaaaaah toxic and boom im getting punished rather than the guys who literally troll picked and fed the whole game.

replies.body:
Good. Nobody needs someone making the game even worse by having a meltdown in chat to utterly no purpose.

Calling for reports is flaming and has zero impact on chances of punishment (at least for anyone else), and calling them out is self-explanatory. Do you expect them to repent or something?

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=dpihtpbP,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-11-23T04:09:10.968+0000)
>
> Good. Nobody needs someone making the game even worse by having a meltdown in chat to utterly no purpose.
> 
> Calling for reports is flaming and has zero impact on chances of punishment (at least for anyone else), and calling them out is self-explanatory. Do you expect them to repent or something?

yeah im the problem when teemo and jax give up 12 kills in the first 10 minutes. right buddy. accountability no longer exists. i didn't curse them out. i didn't call them trash or r%%%%%s. i called them out for obvious troll picks, and then asked the enemy team to report them when they denied 3 straight surrenders.

youre right though. even though this shit happens every game i should just sit through it with a forced smile on my face and pat them on the back for "trying" 

this is the problem with league. you can't say anything to anyone anymore. all you can do is watch as one to two people sabotage every attempt at having fun.

> [{quoted}](name=ScarnMichaelScar,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=dpihtpbP,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-11-23T04:14:47.722+0000)
>
> yeah im the problem

Who's talking about "the" problem? You're **a** problem. This is not some sort of reverse competition, where only the person who was the biggest dick gets a punishment. 

>i didn't curse them out. i didn't call them trash or r%%%%%s.

Care to share your chat logs? You wouldn't be the first to claim such things only to be found lying.
That said, there are plenty of ways to harass others without using curses or those two specific words.

>i called them out for obvious troll picks

Seen weirder things work out well. Teemo ADC used to be quite a thing for a while. Never saw the appeal, but also wouldn't call it a troll pick.


> even though this shit happens every game 

That right there is proof enough for me that your definition of "troll" is extremely loose. And that serves as a perfect example why even if you are convinced that somebody is trolling you **still** have no right to harass them. Because you're not the judge here. You don't decide who is trolling or who isn't, and you most definitely don't get to decide who deserves to be flamed and who doesn't.

>i should just sit through it with a forced smile on my face and pat them on the back for "trying" 

Or, hear me out on this, you could just not say anything.
Just because your negativity is not tolerated doesn't mean you need to fake positivity. Being neutral is just fine.

So your ideal solution is to make their day and encourage them by showing them how mad you are over their antics?

I thought they taught kids not to act like this in fucking preschool.

Im glad you love it because maybe you've realized that "calling them out" will do no good. You've probably realized that lots of players try lots of combinations of champs on bottom lane and theyre usually not trolling, theyre just trying something new. So having teammates go to chat bitching about them and calling them trolls only makes the person whining about it look like an asshole, and annoys the shit out of everyone else who is playing a video game on their free time because its fun, not serious. So yeah, just take it. Its a team game. Its not about other people picking the shit YOU want. Always glad to see another person actually learn the rules. 

Also, you do realize if they are actual trolls (and this is why i think you KNOW they arent) they would do this to get exactly the reaction that you seem to so badly want to give them. You think trolls get upset when people get salty at them? You cant be that ignorant of trolls.

Calling them out isn't going to make them play better.
Asking people to report them isn't going to accomplish more than reporting them yourself.

So why melt down and lose your chit in chat? You are literally only adding to the problem, 'cause now your other teammates have to deal with a whiner in chat AND two trolls.
Hate to break it to you, but if they were playing to win; they weren't breaking any rules.
